alert.note: Alert for Eastern Santa Clara Hills; Mountains Of San Benito County And Interior Monterey County Including Pinnacles National Monument; Northern Monterey Bay; Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Santa Cruz Mountains; Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 12:25PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A line of heavy rain with possible thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Santa Cruz, northwestern San Benito, southeastern Santa Clara and northwestern Monterey Counties through 100 PM PST... At 1224 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gilroy to 14 miles southwest of Carmel-By-The-Sea. Movement was east-southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Hail on roads could make driving dangerous. Locations impacted include... Salinas, Watsonville, Gilroy, Morgan Hill, Hollister, Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Corralitos, Big Sur Village, Pacific Grove, Gonzales, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel Valley Village, Andrew Molera State Park, Partington Ridge, Brown Valley Road, Freedom, Pico Blanco Campground and Prunedale. This includes Highway 1 between Mile Markers 34 and 57, near Mile Marker 59, near Mile Marker 66, and between Mile Markers 69 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
